security: Disclosure of specific financial transactions could compromise operations and personnel associated with these activities. Revealing the financial support to anti-Castro groups could damage relationships with other countries.
summary: A financial report from January 1962 details income and expenses related to a budget of $81,500 for various Cuban operations, including propaganda, support for the Judicatura Cubana Democrática, underground activities, Operación Grieta, and special delegations.
summary_one_paragraph: This report, certified by Comptroller Juan Paula Baez on February 22, 1962, outlines the financial activities for January 1962, covering income of $59,784.50 and expenses of $43,491.26 across different operations related to Cuba. It details deposits and expenses for propaganda ($20,000 deposit, $9,106.76 expenses), Judicatura Cubana Democrática ($5,000 deposit and expenses), underground activities ($25,000 deposit and expenses), Operación Grieta ($4,384.50 deposit and expenses), and special delegations ($5,400 deposit), along with the balances in the bank at the beginning and end of January.
title: Expenses Out of the $81,500.00 Budget
